long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
This "bug" (I wouldn't qualify it as that tough) follows your post about qx.Desktop on mobile devices. I didn't know in which category I had to post so I selected the widgetbrowser.
I tested the qx.desktop widgetbrowser on my iPad and what I found a bit annoying is that sometimes the edit focus on editable fields (textfield, textarea, combobox...) was tricky because it was interpreted as touchmove.
Finally, the focus was set but I had to touch the field again to edit it. Of course, I could have used the "next" and "prev" buttons of the virtual keyboard but sometimes it's simply not possible.
Besides, when the edit mode was set, I wasn't able to make a selection of the text inside the field.
Maybe this should be treated as special case in your event layer (just a suggestion of course) ?
Best,
Benoît.
Thanks for the report. Do you talk about every editable field or only about the table?

From Benoît Collignon via email: "I'm talking about every editable field (actually, I didn't event tried the table widget), only the basic form components.
But I'll try to edit cells to see if the experience is similar this evening."

Sorry for the email to "bugzilla-daemon@qooxdoo.org". I tough there was some sort of cronjob to handle answers thanks to the title of the email.
Indeed I tried to edit the table widget but the zoom is triggered unfortunately. I think there is a special meta tag to disable the zoom but I'm not sure if it can work in all cases.
Best,
Benoît.
We removed the mouse emulation with #8111
